availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, clerk. Maryland native. Married to Sarah A. Dent. Father of Laura Dent, Henry Dent, Mary Dent, Sarah Dent, Kingley Dent, and Edward H. Dent. Tax collector in Louisville in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Lieutenant colonel and organizer of the First Battalion Provost Guard of Louisville from September 23, 1861 to October 3, 1862. Chief of Police of the City of Louisville from March 1862 to May 9, 1862. Colonel of the 34th Kentucky Infantry Regiment from October 3, 1862 to 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 4, Ward 7, p. 353. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, p. 120. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 3, p. 6. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 316, 344-46. Morton O. Childress, "Louisville Police Department" in The Encyclopedia of Louisville, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 565-67.
